item.title: Backup and Restore in PostgreSQL
item.description: PostgreSQL is a object-relational database management system. It is most advanced open soruce relational database. Taking backups using pg_dump : pg_dump is a utility for backing up a PostgreSQL database. We can extract the database in script file or archive file formats : Script Files : These are plain-text files containing the SQL commands. We can restore data from these script files using psql. Archive Files : The archive files allow pg_restore to rebuild the database.
